decks.notes: This UWx control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of counterspells, discard spells, and removal while also generating card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Search for Azcanta. The deck also has powerful win conditions in the form of planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, as well as angels from Entreat the Angels. The mana base is carefully constructed to support casting spells of different colors efficiently, and the deck includes versatile removal options like Swords to Plowshares and Toxic Deluge.

The main concept of this deck is to use efficient and disruptive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, along with powerful control spells like Force of Will and Hymn to Tourach, to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig through the deck and find the necessary cards to maintain tempo and stay ahead. The combination of aggression and disruption makes this deck a versatile and strong choice in the Legacy format.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's plays while maintaining control of the game through a combination of powerful creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Baleful Strix, along with efficient removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Fatal Push. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor also helps to control the board and dictate the pace of the game. With a strong mix of disruption, card advantage, and efficient threats, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in order to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana and draw cards quickly by playing multiple Elves in a turn. Utilizing Glimpse of Nature and Heritage Druid's ability, players can chain together Elves to create a strong board presence and set up for powerful finishers like Natural Order for Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Deathrite Shaman and Reclamation Sage to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast mana production and card advantage to win the game quickly.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent while deploying efficient threats to apply pressure. It combines disruptive elements like hand disruption spells and removal with powerful threats like True-Name Nemesis and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. The deck aims to control the game early on with cards like Brainstorm and Force of Will, before closing out the game with hard-to-answer threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the various colors of mana needed for the spells in the deck. Overall, the deck aims to be versatile and proactive in its game plan.

This Goblin aggro deck focuses on using Food Chain and Goblins with powerful ETB effects to generate mana and overwhelm the opponent with speed and aggression. By utilizing cards like Goblin Lackey, Goblin Matron, and Goblin Ringleader to search for key Goblins while also creating a strong board presence, the deck aims to quickly outpace the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, cards like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Lightning Crafter provide additional combo potential to further pressure the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to use the Painter's Servant combo with Grindstone to mill the opponent's entire library, winning the game instantly. This combo is supported by counterspells and removal spells to protect it, as well as card selection and card advantage engines to find the combo pieces quickly. The deck also includes disruptive creatures like Notion Thief and Vendilion Clique to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is optimized to support both the color requirements of the deck and the activated abilities of Search for Azcanta.

This deck aims to quickly play and protect high-value creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Stoneforge Mystic while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Gaddock Teeg. It also includes cards like Green Sun's Zenith to tutor for specific creatures and Punishing Fire to control the board. The use of mana dorks like Birds of Paradise and Deathrite Shaman allows for quick ramping, while the combination of Wasteland and creature removal spells like Swords to Plowshares helps keep the opponent on the back foot.

The deck aims to control the game by disrupting the opponent with removal and hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Swords to Plowshares, while also having access to powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope. The Stoneblade strategy revolves around using Stoneforge Mystic to search for and put equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice into play, allowing for a strong offensive and defensive presence on the battlefield. The deck also utilizes cards like True-Name Nemesis and Baleful Strix for additional value and protection.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base while deploying threats quickly and efficiently. By utilizing cards like Winter Orb, Choke, and Wasteland, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's development and secure an advantage. The deck also includes powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Dark Confidant to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's resources while maintaining a strong board presence to secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to control the board by disrupting your opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, while also having threats like Tidehollow Sculler and Stoneforge Mystic to apply pressure. The deck utilizes cards like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope to keep the opponent in check and maintain control of the game. Additionally, the deck includes a powerful removal suite with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Toxic Deluge to deal with threats efficiently. The deck also has a strong equipment package with Umezawa's Jitte, Sword of Fire and Ice, and Batterskull to further enhance its aggressiveness and resilience.

The main focus of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base by playing cards like Magus of the Moon, Blood Moon, and Chalice of the Void, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Hazoret the Fervent. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Abrade, while using fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Simian Spirit Guide to power out threats quickly. Chandra, Torch of Defiance provides additional card advantage and removal, solidifying the deck's aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on using lands as resources to control the opponent's options and disrupt their strategy. By utilizing cards like Ghost Quarter, Wasteland, and Crop Rotation, the deck can target key lands from the opponent and hinder their ability to develop their board. Additionally, with cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage, the deck can create a powerful 20/20 indestructible creature quickly. The deck also has access to various recursion effects with Life from the Loam and Punishing Fire, providing long-term value and inevitability in the late game.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and board while generating card advantage through cards like Ancestral Vision, Hymn to Tourach, and Shardless Agent. By using disruptive spells like Collective Brutality and Force of Will, along with powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, this deck aims to control the game tempo and outvalue the opponent. Additionally, the deck utilizes efficient creatures like Baleful Strix and Deathrite Shaman to apply pressure and close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on controlling the game with counterspells and removal, while also using powerful equipment and planeswalkers to establish a strong board presence. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy, protect key threats like True-Name Nemesis and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and ultimately outvalue the opponent with card advantage and versatile options. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and versatility, with utility lands like Wasteland and Karakas to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. Ultimately, the goal is to control the game's pace and win with powerful threats and game-ending equipment.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using counter spells and removal, while also utilizing powerful card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Counterbalance and Council's Judgment, while also having a win condition in Entreat the Angels. The mana base is built to support the dual color requirements of the deck, and includes powerful card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for key cards. The overall goal is to out-value the opponent and control the pace of the game.
